intro: Ennealophus boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in a fine pubescence, which helps protect it from harsh weather. Ennealophus boliviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to extreme environments.
